body_html: Not directly, instead we created torch::CPU and torch::CUDA which return VariableTypes such that e.g. at::ones(torch::CPU(kFloat), {5}) gives you a variable (upcast to Tensor) -- see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/cpp_extensions/extension.cpp#L9
body_text: Not directly, instead we created torch::CPU and torch::CUDA which return VariableTypes such that e.g. at::ones(torch::CPU(kFloat), {5}) gives you a variable (upcast to Tensor) -- see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/cpp_extensions/extension.cpp#L9
body: Not directly, instead we created `torch::CPU` and `torch::CUDA` which return `VariableType`s such that e.g. `at::ones(torch::CPU(kFloat), {5})` gives you a variable (upcast to Tensor) -- see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/cpp_extensions/extension.cpp#L9
